rncp.title: Plant Care Assistant
rncp.description: A web app to help users take care of their plants, built as part of my RNCP diploma

shoppingCart.title: Shopping Cart
shoppingCart.description: E-commerce shopping cart built as part of The Odin Project

navigatorBattleship.title: Battleship Game
navigatorBattleship.description: This is a version of the classic board game Battleship, built using TypeScript and Test-Driven Development (TDD).

knightsTravail.title: Knights Travail Solution
knightsTravail.description: This project is a solution to the Knights Travail problem, implemented using Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) practices in TypeScript. The Knights Travail problem involves finding the shortest path for a knight on a chessboard from one point to another.

binarySearchTree.title: Binary Search Tree Implementation
binarySearchTree.description: This project is a simple implementation of a Binary Search Tree (BST) in TypeScript. It includes a BinarySearchTree class and a createTreeNode function for creating nodes.

hashmapImplementation.title: Hashmap Implementation
hashmapImplementation.description: This repository contains a simple implementation of a hash map data structure in TypeScript. The hash map uses separate chaining for collision resolution, with each bucket in the hash map being a linked list.

about.title: About me
about.bio1: I have travelled the world, I have a bachelors in Philosophy (my dissertation was on the ethical implications of Artificial Intelligence, back in 2008) and am now living in France. During the pandemic (the real one, not the board game) I began my journey of switching careers, first with some self study, then with a bootcamp and finally finding a school in France with a placement program for my first professional role as a developer.
about.bio2: I am early on in my new career and am enjoying learning as much about being a developer as possible, currently focusing on Web Development (React and Next.js currently, but dabbling with Vue in solidarity with my adoptive home country) but also learning about lower level programming languages (C# and .Net at the moment) as well as more esoteric knowledge (want to improve my Bash scripting skills, use my Raspberry Pi for something useful at home) looking for work and continuing to learn every day, dont hesitate to have a look at my projects!
